creator: siberski@learninglab.de
text:
The Log4j Logging and Level classes are nearly compatible to its util.logging 
counterpart, but there are some methods and constants which currently have 
different names:
isLoggable() vs. isEnabledFor()
severe()     vs. error()
warning()    vs. warn()
The same applies to Level: 
SEVERE       vs. ERROR 
WARNING      vs. WARN
This makes porting of code like the following to log4j more work than 
necessary:
    if ( log.isLoggable(Level.WARNING) ) {
         log.warning("this is a warning");
    }
Therefore these methods/constants should be added (as aliases) to the log4j 
API.
